subject: Re: The Stanley
author: purplespacefriend
full_text:
Yep, she was definately surprised. 

 Frank-S


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@...> 
wrote:
>
> Hi Frank.  Where's the poloroid when you need it?!?  I bet the 
expression on the woman's 
> face was priceless when the RoboBox said "Loves to cook."  :0)
> 
> Margaret
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@> 
wrote:
> >
> > 
> >  Well, I had a good time, did several talks, and--get this! An 
investigation. Or rather I 
> kinda tagged along on a group's investigation and used one of the 
boxes. There was 
> entities answering questions, and responding tot he group members. 
I gave the group the 
> tape, so I won't be able able to play those. On my own recordings, 
the spirits were pretty 
> the same as  get at home, and even my son come through wiht "My 
father did this", which 
> I played for a larger group. I loaned a box to another group, and 
they also got entities to 
> answer questions, and interact. 
> >  
> >  RoboBox did perform for a group, with at least one meaningful 
comment. A woman 
> came to the table afte the talk, and asked " Do they onokly talk 
for you"", and immediately 
> RoboBox put out "for you", followed after a few seconds "Loves to 
cook", the woman was a 
> cook!
> >  
> >  The whole thing is very energy intense. 
> >  Frank-S
